question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Storage Isolation] Does InMemoryStorage properly isolate execution contexts, or can multiple profiling runs interfere with each other's state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Storage Persistence] Can data written to InMemoryStorage at line 169 persist across runs in unexpected ways that violate isolation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Module Bytes Validation] Does add_module_bytes at lines 175-176 validate that the byte array is actually valid compiled module bytecode? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Version Downgrade Attack] Can an attacker specify older Move bytecode versions that lack security fixes present in LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Feature Incompatibility] Can enable_all() at line 150 enable mutually incompatible features that cause undefined behavior when combined? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: compile_test_modules()] [Iterator Invalidation] Can the into_iter() at line 134 be exploited if the module_sources array is somehow mutated during iteration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Collection Modification During Iteration] Are the test_modules iterated at lines 172 and 180/184 protected from concurrent modification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Enum Variant Confusion] Can the Entrypoint enum at lines 34-37 be manipulated to execute the wrong variant, causing type confusion between scripts and modules? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-profiling/src/bins/run_move.rs] [Function: main()] [Pattern Match Exhaustiveness] Is the match statement at line 204 truly exhaustive, or can future enum variants be added that cause undefined behavior? (Low)
